reviews.review_msg: She's a nice lady but her class is pretty brutal. Everything you learn is self taught and her lectures are confusing and way too fast. Don't even get me started about contacting her outside of class - it's like she's allergic to email or something. You have to mark your own workbook, and she marks quizzes super harshly. Would not recommend Naoko...
Naoko Sensei is a great professor. She's my goat for real.
Awful teaching

Pretty good choice as elective course. Naoko always let us make different groups to practice which is really useful.  
If you are interested in Japanese, do not hesitate to take this course.
Best elective class ever. No cons all pros.
Quiz every class but really helps. Work hard can guarantee a good grade. VERY KIND!!!!!
Amazing prof, I would recommend Naoko over any other Japanese instructors at SFU.

Naoko is the best professor I've met so far in SFU. She not only knows a lot about Japanese language, she also makes the language fun and interesting for students to learn. If you ever want to take Japanese, take it with Naoko. You won't be disappointed!
BEST prof @SFU.
The class is interesting and helpful.However, the vocab is hard to remember.
The prof never shows up. This TA is really mean. The online distance course is really tough. The course outline is unreasonable.The worst TA I had.
good prof! she's willing to help and is very friendly!

I love this prof!! The course is hard though (if you're lazy like me - coz same with every language course, you'll end up having to memorize stuff. But she's so helpful and cheer u up. Bad side - quiz every class lol. Good side, if thinking of taking Jap, then choose Naoko, best Jap prof ever!
Great Jap. teacher! Very focused on students' progress and trying to improve student's ability to speaking Japanese. Always smiles and making fun in her classes.
The worst TA I ever had. She is really tough and mean. If you have any problem, she will not help you. The course outline is quite unreasonable.
He's a funny guy!!
He is so funny and nice =)
He is really nice to everyone unless you talk when he is talking. Quizzes are pretty easy and straight forward. But you must DO WORK regularly.
You will fall in love with him ;)

Very easy-going. Very lenient to students. I suggest taking this course with a friend. One of the oral tests require you to practice with a partner. Getting an A+ is actually possible in this course!!! But really, Shinno Sensei is a great teacher. Although I'm a little disappointed that there is too little to learn in this course.

Shinno is a super good instructor!! He is truly passionate in his job and cares about his students acedemics in his course. Overall, he is not a tough teacher at all. He says that you are not allowed to make up a quiz if you are late, but in the end, he still allows you to make up it. Easy & FUN! =)

Shinno sensee is a hard marker on writing (hiragana, katakana..etc) but he's a good explainer, and cares about the students. He's also very funny! Great guy! THe course itself is good too! Highly recommended if you have an interest in Japn language.
Bad marker! extremely unfair....marks docked off out of nowhere...and more of a teasing than teaching tone...bad bad bad  (but the course itself was pretty interesting and not very hard)
She displays a very caring and excited attitude about teaching the class, she always tries to make the class as fun as possible and more oriented around fun activities instead of textbook reading.

Amazing instructor!!! Lectures are fun, well-structured and very very interactive. Assignments and exams are fair. She seemed to be a bit particular about kanji accuracy. However, she is good at explaining things and very knowledgeable. Morishita is hilarious and very inspirational! Take her course!! I wish she teaches 110 level, too.

She encourages students to participate regardless of their knowledge level and is a helpful and punctual teacher. She is honest, supportive, kind, and positive!!  You must frequently review the assignments listed in the syllabus if you want to receive a decent mark. 
Overall, it's a fun class to be in!!

Morishita sensei is extremely good at creating a comfortable and engaging environment.  
She is super friendly, kind and supportive. She exceeded my expectations for a language professor in every way.  Participation does matter, show up to all her classes.  Finish your Homework ahead of time.  Overall, definitely fun class to take!! Recommended.
She is the worst prof i have ever taken.

Don't take her class unless you have learned Japanese before. If you are a beginner who want to get good mark in her class, I suggest you find a tutor. Omae uses a textbook written by herself.It is terrible and has lots of mistake in it. She didn't teach grammar and explain vocabulary,you have to memorize everything in her textbook.

I've gotta say, she's one terrible prof. She doesn't have hard copy of the book and asks you to print it off from a bunch of scanned pdf files (tiff). It's a pain in.. You can bring laptop to class, but she said she hates it so there that. If you are taking her class, good luck finding the instructions. It's always not clear, so there you have it.

I like her notes but I am so disappointed that the way she used was totally wasting our time. Ironically that her TA uses the notes in a much better way than she does. If you don't have any previous knowledge in Japanese, don't take it.

I think Omae is a great teacher. Everyone in my class seems to like her. She has her own way of teaching and I think it's an effective way to learn a language. She is picky about the shapes of characters. Good idea to show her your writing after learning the characters to make sure you get them right. Not a hard course but requires a lot of work.

Do not hold a pencil/pen (most people do it because it's a habit) when she tells you to not write and pay attention to the overhead!! She'll tell you to get out of the room O_O. I never get enough time to finish practicing dialoges with my partner in class. And...it's scary when she looks at you.

How does she still have a job? Unclear. Unnecessarily difficult. Doesn't stop to clarify, just races through the material with reckless abandon. She's effectively killed my interest in learning how to speak Japanese.

She expects so much from student. She teaches everything very quickly but not throughly, and she expects you to know it way away. Her teaching style and her textbook are extremely unorganized. She doesn't have a systematic way of teaching, she expects u to pick up the material along the way.Her exam is extremely difficult, and she's picky onWriting

Not all the classes are taught by her.  Some sections are taught by TAs. Overall organization of the class is horrible and there is no clear outline of what we are expected to do. TA was not good at teaching either. Final is extremely hard.  Textbooks are made by her, are not very good and has lots of erros. Also, cannot be sold back or refunded.
doesn't know how to teach, way too hard, way too picky, tries to embarrass people in class and she thinks she's cute.
Very Picky, If you are taking this class, make sure your writing form is identical to the book, even a little bit off and she will give you zero.  Funny though, because her writing is just as bad.
No Comments
Strict, but okay once you get used to her style
can seem VERY intimidating at times, but you get used to it.
Kind of annoying

Furukawa sensei was a caring, engaging, and sympathetic professor. In order to succeed in her class, you need to study at home during your free time, and make sure to watch the lecture videos. The classes are only there to supplement what you have learnt at home.

This class moves fast and is very tough, it was by far the most work of any of my classes. That being said, if you are up for that, this class is a very well made and lost of fun if you are committed to it! Make sure to get the in physical textbook and a Genkouyoushi notebook for writing! You will have a good time in Furukawa's Class for sure!!

JAPN100 was the most enjoyable course I took. The quality dipped when moved online, but this is absolutely worth taking when offline if you are interested in picking up jp. You can tell she really enjoys teaching the class, fellow weebs are encouraged to join. If you want to get a headstart, buy the v3 GENKI 1 workbook and dl the v2 textbook.

The in-class quizzes were very easy, but she did not prepare us properly for the final exam at all. Her classroom also felt very hostile, no one was willing to practice with each other which is unlike most language classes. Instead of helping students who were struggling to read out loud, she would tell them to hurry up.

Super confusing - I knew some of the material beforehand but she made me MORE confused than before! She also makes a lot of mistakes when explaining. You have to memorize vocab pretty fast, but only need to know how to read kanji from that lesson's section in the back of the textbook.
super nice prof and extremely helpful, but he is a TA, might not be teaching Jap in the future. If he ever teaches a higher level jap, i would definitely take his class!
Pretty nice guy. Always willing to help:)
